content.description: SDS On the big rail low and straight up
content.location:
On the Lost Gulley Boulders

Approach Beta:

If your looking at the Prowler Boulder look for the large ravine (almost another set of hills) to the right of it. Look for a somewhat established trail up the heart of gully. Follow this till you begin to traverse a top the spines of rock that make up the ravine. (They really are way out there but worth it) Be on the look out for the boulder leaning on the nice slab. Slab is Mushroom Dance and leaning boulder to the left is the Lost Boulder. Check the photo for visual beta.

The right route on the Lost Boulder.

content.description: Climb the off vertical wall using good pockets and crimps, use caution at the top. The last jug is loose but won't come off unless you start tugging really hard..
content.location: Wayyyyy outta the way. Climb all the mystery routes before looking for this thing.

content.description: SDS and bear down on crimps, find any feet and then huck for the left hand. In all honesty though this problem sucks. It has the "worst" view, it's by itself, has essentially no moves to it, and the rock was graffiti'd by some hormonal loser.
content.location: Take a right heading away from all the fun bp's in the Lost Gully. There's a wooden 9ft pole sticking out of the ground nearby. Trying to climb the wooden pole is sorta fun/scary. FA Sprekum Frayce 1869

content.description: Same start holds as Sour Skittles but exit left on the pinches and hueco
content.location:
The left route on the Lost Boulder.

See (Sour Skittles) for approach beta
